review:
6/10 (Long story short) An average dating simulator where you date attack helicopters.

My takeaway: Attack Helicopter Dating Simulator was memorable for me solely because of the premise and not really because of the gameplay, story, art, music, or love interests. They tackle creating a dating sim based around Attack Helicopters in a way that ends up being completely uninspired- everything about this title is extremely average. If it wasn’t for the crazy premise I don’t think I’d be recommending it. If you’re wanting a joke title to play for the giggles I definitely recommend this title but if you’re wanting a gripping dating simulator where you actually feel for the characters- this isn’t for you.

I LOVED the introductions of the characters so when I started playing the game I was flying high with how corny and full of humor this title was but then the game continued and my initial love for it dwindled. The writing is so incredibly mid that at times it felt like a Wattpad fan-fiction. The consequences of your choices are so incredibly random that you have absolutely no control over how the story goes in a game format where the main selling point is allowing players to have control over the story. Maybe I’m just old though and this random humor isn’t for me. It just felt lazy.

[u]Pros[/u]
[list]
   [*] Date attack helicopters!
   [*] Plays smooth
   [*] Self aware corny
   [*] Accurate descriptions of the helicopters is genuinely funny
[/list]

[u]Cons[/u]
[list]
   [*] Mid everything (art, story, music, helicopters)
   [*] Not memorable aside from attack helicopters
   [*] Random. Very random. No control whatsoever.
   [*] uwu random xD type humor
   [*] Felt like it was made by an edgy teen
 [/list]

[spoiler] Mil MI24 is the best girl (obviously)  [/spoiler]

review:
Attack Helicopter Dating Simulator es, sin duda, una de las obras mas importantes y conocidas del fantástico desarrollador Curse Box Studios. 

La obra me ha gustado principalmente por su carácter ficticio y reflexivo, ya que a pesar de lo absurdo que puede parecer a primera vista, el autor nos transmite un profundo mensaje: 
-perseguir nuestros sueños: puesto que incluso alguien ordinario puede alcanzar lo que se propone
-escuchar a nuestro corazón
-incluso los helicópteros de ataque pueden amar
Esta novela nos transmite la importancia de luchar por nuestros sueños por mi imposibles que nos parezcan. Nos habla de que nunca es demasiado tarde para lograrlos y de que lleguemos hasta donde lleguemos, siempre habremos aprendido algo por el camino. El alquimista me ha recordado a los cuentos que leíamos de pequeños. Frases sencillas, historias simples, raras e imposibles quizá, pero que ocultan un mensaje fuerte e importante.  

La prosa del escritor es muy curiosa. La habilidad que demuestra para describir conceptos muy complejos mediante frases simples es admirable. Una novela que nos deja con sensaciones positivas, y que nos permite reflexionar sobre nosotros y el interminable abanico de oportunidades que tenemos en esta vida. 

Enseñanzas de la vida que nos da esta novela:

1. El miedo es un obstáculo mayor que el obstáculo en sí: el miedo forma parte de nuestras emociones básicas, siempre nos va a acompañar. Hay que saber controlarlo para que no se convierta en un obstáculo que nos impide alcanzar lo que deseamos y limite nuestro poder de decisión.

2. La verdad o lo verdadero es duradero: a la hora de tomar decisiones veremos que aquello que no está destinado a quedarse con nosotros será efímero.

3. Toma decisiones: confía en ti. La auto-confianza es un logro que debemos alcanzar para seguir adelante. Para ello, es importante entender que no existen decisiones buenas o malas sino valiosas para nuestro enriquecimiento personal.

4. Actúa siempre: la acción es la única manera de aprender. Los cambios traen consigo aprendizajes y son, al fin y al cabo, la única manera de avanzar para alcanzar nuestros sueños.

5. No seas realista: los mayores logros e innovaciones del mundo empiezan con una mente que ignora lo imposible.

Creo que Attack Helicopter Dating Simulator es una de las obras mas interesantes que he leído, y la considero recomendable a todos los amantes de la lectura. Es una historia cautivadora, que te robara el corazón y te hará soltar unas cuantas lágrimas. Un poco lento, pero muy bien manejado. Personajes muy bien estructurados, que se ganaran un lugar en sus corazones y con una pequeña historia de amor, para enamorarse un poco más de la vida. Totalmente recomendado.

[H1]헬기소녀(?)들과 데이트 하는 게임. 이거 성인게임 아닙니다.[/H1]
[B]이 게임은 Dripgun님께서 제게 선물해주신 게임입니다. 감사드립니다.

번역기가 안먹어서 고마운 게임입니다.[/B]

성우 없음. 갤러리 없음(있을 필요가 없음). 공군에 입대하라고 함. 소녀들이 열받으면 미사일 쏨.

예전에 비둘기랑 연애하는 게임을 플레이해본적이 있었는데 이건... 그보다 더 심합니다. 적어도 비둘기랑 연애하는 게임은 히로인이 빡쳤다고 미사일 발사 -> 게임오버 되지는 않았어요. 이 게임에 엔딩이 여러가지가 있는데 등장하는 히로인들 특성상 단 한번이라도 공격당하면 그대로 게임오버 뜹니다. 따로 연출이나 효과를 주며 게임오버 당하는게 아니라 그냥 대사창에 Game Over라고 뜨면서 그냥 죽습니다. 전쟁의 허무함에 대해 생각하게 하는 항목이었습니다.

어차피 이 게임은 정상적인 게임이 아닙니다. 정신 바짝 차리지 않으면 삽시간에 인간쓰레기(물리적)가 됩니다. 덕분에 번역기가 제대로 안먹어서 고마운 게임은 정말 오래간만입니다. 대부분의 대사가 번역이 되지 않아 무슨 뜻인지 모르게 되어 있었으나 사전찾아가며 번역할 가치는 없는 게임이라 그냥 알아들으면 알아듣고 모르면 그냥 패스하는 형식으로 플레이 했습니다. 그래서 제 멘탈은 될대로 되라는 식으로 살아남았네요. 이게 다행인지 아니면 불운인지 모르겠습니다.

플레이 하다보면 소녀들끼리 미사일 쏘고 노는(싸우는)스토리가 벌어지기도 하는데 여기서도 잘못하면 주인공이 유폭되어 죽을수 있습니다. 조심하시길...

비둘기랑 연애하는 게임...과는 비교 못하겠습니다. 그 게임은 소위 말하는 "레전드"급이고 이건 그냥 지나가다 개한테 물린 게임이라고 생각하겠습니다.ㅠㅠ

[h1]누가 이걸 사겠다면 따로 뭐라 말 못하겠습니다. 그냥 돈이 아깝다라고 생각하겠습니다.[/h1]


[b]다시한번 이 게임을 선물해주신 Dripgun님께 감사드립니다.[/b]

review:
A goofy Visual Novel about going to an Academy for Attack Helicopters to train. There is a variety of different characters to interact with during the game and choices matter due a point system placed in the game. Higher the points you have for each character, the higher the chances certain options are available later in the game. Low point counts may omit choices being available for the character of one's choosing.

While the game is based around humor and self depreciation, there are drawbacks that might turn away any fans of the seasoned visual novel/parody enthusiast. 

Assets and background images might not be up to par with some peoples' expectations. There might be a glitch or two in the textbox or textures during a playthrough. The storyline may not be pleasing to some players and those not fond gags, puns, and humor relating to attack helicopters and of the /k/ variety. There are some grammatical errors occasionally found in the game but they're not game breaking or greatly intruding on the storyline (if I recall, the developers are from Argentina-while the publisher is US based).

Length is another concern to address, the game can be completed in about an hours length of time depending on choices and how a player might approach the game. Luckily due to the short length of time and the large variety of players, the game is easily re-playable. 

Lastly, the biggest issue at hand is price, being at $9.99 USD, a game such as this being short in length and rather lacking in many regards compared to cheaper priced and some free Visual Novel games offered on Steam and elsewhere online. For some, 60+ minutes of gameplay might not be enough to justify the price tag and I agree with that. I suggest getting the game while it is on sale at a reduced price.

review:
Tl;dr - A darn funny game rife with spelling errors. Buy it on sale.

PROS:
-The humor is on point. 
-Heart-pounding rock-paper-scissors action!

CONS:
-The spelling is atrocious.
-The price seems a little high for what you get.

This game is downright hilarious. If you enjoy the humor of "Stay! Stay!" and "Panzermadels," you'll love this just as much. It's self-aware enough to poke fun at itself (and others), but not so much that it's completely distracting. I would talk about the 'immersion,' but it's a helicopter dating simulator - what immersion? 

Unfortuately, this game badly needs an editor. Even running through it once would have helped it immensely. It's YouTube-conspiracy-video-comment-section bad. Also, the price at release ($9.99) seems a tad high. Obviously, with the dozens of possible endings (I'm assuming there are dozens, anway. It sure looked like it.), there is replayability, which is probably how they're justifying the cost. Even then, I'm still not sure it's worth it. My suggestion? Wait for it to go on sale.

This is it fam, we've finally reached peak video game. No game on Earth will ever be able to live up to the pure insanity that we have reached. Look, I like tanks and helicopters as much as the next guy. I get it, sometimes I might occasionally find one sexually attractive, but this is... I'm honestly at a loss for words. Sometimes I think if everyone fighting in World War II had seen what it would lead to, they would have laid down their arms and fought together to stop this madness.

Still a 10/10 though for the number of "tail rotor" jokes though, so there's that.

review:
They really did it.
Absolute madmen.

10/10 would go on a mission again.

If you enjoyed Panzermadels you will enjoy this.
It has a lot of references to really modern topics (some of them happening less than a month previously to release).
And it has that certain "meme-y internet feel" which I find quite amusing.
Not perfect, but worth every penny.
(there are a few spelling mistakes, but it's not a big problem)
